Html:
I change the themes to MadTri but the buttons don’t change.
The yellow brown button’s look funny in a blue page.
IS there a easy way to fix this?
Photoshop and change the image color will do the trick.

I change the buttons that I could find in \App_Themes\ Clubsite\ images
and madtri\images but they did not change.
Is there some place else?

Thank you
I got them to change it took a couple times opening the site to make the change.
Looks better.

Now the rss-img is not showing only a box with a red X rss-img ? any Ideals?
Look in the other theme folders. I found the missing pieces by poking around.

Thank you Tina

I found them in the clubsite folder and move them to MadTri folder.
Also had to move print.png image.
Everything is working and looking great.

When I go to switch from source to design in the enevts\calendar.aspx page I get this error
Cannot switch views: Validation )ASP.Net): Attribute “ruant” can be specified only once in a tag.

So I cannot change the buttons.

I did get the buttons change in the: events\edit.aspx & news\list.aspx.

I do not know how to change the edit, remove, save & remove buttons in the news\edit.aspx?

lhr,

The problem with the Designer error is that there is a button (probably the RSS button) that has 2 runat="server" definitions. Just delete one of them. It should run from there.

z2bass

Thank you for your Patience. But being a novice which button and where?
What do you mean by "which button and where"? Do you mean where is the image stored and how it gets pushed to the page?

I asked
When I go to switch from source to design in the enevts\calendar.aspx page I get this error
Cannot switch views: Validation )ASP.Net): Attribute “ruant” can be specified only once in a tag.

You replyed
The problem with the Designer error is that there is a button (probably the RSS button) that has 2 runat="server" definitions. Just delete one of them. It should run from there.

I asked "which button and where"?
Look in the error list window. It should tell you the line number that contains the error.

Thank you z2bass

I was able to switch from to design and edit the buttons in the events\calendar.aspx.
How do you edit the buttons (edit & remove) that are connected to Repeater task box?
